item.title: Atlanta Fed President Bostic says he'll leave position when his term expires in February
item.description: Atlanta Federal Reserve President Raphael Bostic said Wednesday he will be leaving his position when his term expires in February.

item.title: The shutdown put jobs and inflation data on hold. Here's when it could be back — and what it might say
item.description: Economic data releases — payroll and jobs reports, CPI and PPI — have lagged during the government shutdown and likely will take some time to get roll...

item.title: 'Ghost job' postings are adding another layer of uncertainty to the stalling jobs picture
item.description: Since the beginning of 2024, job openings have outnumbered hires by more than 2.2 million a month.

item.title: Stock investors are buoying the economy. A labor market breakdown could end that
item.description: Government labor data could paint a darker economic picture, leading to a market slide that would throw cold water on the outlook of those who are wel...

item.title: Nexperia parent shares jump 6% as Beijing signals thaw in tensions with Netherlands
item.description: The dispute over ownership and control of the Dutch-based Nexperia has led global automakers to warn impacts from a shortage of chip supplies.
